videos.title: A Plan is Not a Strategy by Roger Martin
videos.label: martin
instructions: Watch the video below.
In your group, discuss and formulate:
A concise definition of strategy, according to Roger Martin.
The key elements of a successful strategy, as highlighted by Martin.

What is the main focus or priority that Martin places on strategy development? What does he consider the most important aspect, and what is the ultimate objective or purpose of a good strategy, according to him?

assignment.title: Assignment: Developing Your Individual Strategy Blueprint
assignment.outcome: A personal strategy blueprint for a specific business case using a unique strategy framework.
assignment.instructions: This assignment will guide you through creating a personalised strategy blueprint by synthesising key concepts from the sources. Each step involves reflection tasks to help you make informed choices.

steps.title: Defining Strategy vs. Planning
steps.reflect: Consider your own professional experiences. Have you encountered situations where planning was mistaken for strategy? What were the consequences?

steps.title: Identifying Your Game
steps.reflect: Is your business context a finite or infinite game? How does this understanding impact your strategic approach?

steps.title: Understanding Value Creation
steps.reflect: Using the value stick concept, analyse a recent project or initiative. How was value created for customers, employees, and the company?

steps.title: Crafting Your Just Cause
steps.reflect: What is the deeper purpose behind your business or project? Articulate a compelling Just Cause that inspires commitment and sacrifice.

steps.title: Choosing Your Strategic Elements
strategicConcepts: Playing to Win (Source): Focus on a clear theory of victory, not just a list of activities.
Customer-Centric Outcomes (Source): Define success based on customer behaviour and market response.
Playing the Infinite Game (Source): Embrace adaptability, evolving rules, and the pursuit of longevity.
Value Stick Components (Source): Strategically leverage willingness to pay, willingness to sell, and margins.
Courageous Leadership (Source): Prioritise long-term vision and ethical decision-making.
Trusting Teams (Source): Foster an environment of psychological safety and open communication.
Worthy Rivals (Source): Use competitors as benchmarks for improvement and innovation.
Choosing Your Customers (Source): Define your ideal target audience and tailor your approach accordingly.
steps.reflect: Select 3-4 strategic elements that resonate most strongly with you and your business case. Justify your choices.

steps.title: Building Your Strategy Blueprint
steps.task: Create a concise, one-page strategy blueprint outlining the following:
components: Business Case: Briefly describe the specific challenge or opportunity you're addressing.
Just Cause: State your overarching purpose and desired impact.
Chosen Strategic Elements: List the 3-4 elements you selected.
Actionable Strategies: For each element, define 2-3 specific actions you'll take to apply it to your business case.
steps.description: This individual blueprint will serve as your roadmap for strategic decision-making and action. By grounding your choices in a clear framework and purposeful vision, you can navigate complexity and achieve meaningful results.

assignment.finalDeliverable: Submit your personal strategy blueprint in a concise, one-page document.
